definitions: scene of wild disorder and confusion with loud noise and uproar
examples: The classroom turned into complete bedlam when the teacher left
Holiday shopping created absolute bedlam at the mall yesterday

definitions: member of a traditionally nomadic Arab people living in desert regions
examples: The Bedouin guide led tourists through the Sahara Desert
Traditional Bedouin hospitality includes serving tea to guests

definitions: Ludwig van Beethoven, renowned German composer and pianist of the Classical and Romantic periods
examples: Beethoven composed nine symphonies despite his progressive hearing loss
The concert featured Beethoven's famous Fifth Symphony

definitions: member of a Christian monastic order following the Rule of Saint Benedict
sweet herbal liqueur originally made by Benedictine monks in France
examples: The Benedictine monks maintain a life of prayer and work
The abbey follows strict Benedictine traditions dating back centuries
He ordered Benedictine liqueur as an after-dinner digestif
The bartender mixed cocktails using Benedictine and brandy

definitions: political and economic union of Belgium, the Netherlands, and Luxembourg
examples: The Benelux countries signed new trade agreements last month
Many companies establish headquarters in the Benelux region

definitions: region in South Asia comprising Bangladesh and the Indian state of West Bengal
examples: The Bengal region is known for its rich cultural heritage
Bengal tigers are native to this geographical area

definitions: Indo-Aryan language spoken in Bangladesh and the Indian state of West Bengal
person native to or inhabitant of the Bengal region
examples: She studies Bengali literature at the university level
Bengali is one of the most spoken languages in the world
The Bengali community celebrates Durga Puja with great enthusiasm
My Bengali friend taught me traditional cooking techniques

definitions: major seaport city in Washington state known for technology companies and coffee culture
examples: Seattle is home to major tech companies like Amazon
The famous Space Needle defines Seattle's distinctive skyline

definitions: action of withdrawing formally from membership of a political state or religious organization
examples: The state's secession from the union sparked a civil war
Several members threatened secession from the international organization

definitions: permanent administrative office or department responsible for carrying out the work of an organization
examples: The UN Secretariat coordinates all administrative functions globally
She works in the secretariat handling diplomatic correspondence

definitions: Jewish ritual feast marking the beginning of Passover with symbolic foods and readings
examples: The family gathered for the Passover Seder on Friday night
Each food at the Seder has special symbolic meaning

definitions: member of a Native American people originally from Florida
examples: The Seminole tribe has a rich history in Florida
Seminole culture includes unique patchwork clothing and traditions

definitions: member of peoples speaking Semitic languages including Arabs, Jews, and ancient Assyrians
examples: Ancient Semite civilizations contributed greatly to human culture
The term Semite encompasses various Middle Eastern ethnic groups

definitions: relating to the family of languages that includes Hebrew, Arabic, and Aramaic
examples: Hebrew and Arabic are both Semitic languages with similarities
She specializes in ancient Semitic texts and inscriptions

definitions: member of a Native American people of the Iroquois Confederacy
Lucius Annaeus Seneca, Roman Stoic philosopher and statesman
examples: The Seneca nation traditionally lived in western New York
Seneca leaders played important roles in colonial history
Seneca wrote influential essays on Stoic philosophy
Students study Seneca's moral letters in philosophy classes

definitions: country in West Africa on the Atlantic coast with capital at Dakar
examples: Senegal gained independence from France in nineteen sixty
The president of Senegal addressed the UN General Assembly

definitions: native or inhabitant of Senegal or relating to this West African country
examples: The Senegalese artist exhibited her work in Paris
Senegalese cuisine features dishes like thieboudienne and yassa

definitions: Spanish title equivalent to Mister used before a man's name
examples: Senor Garcia will be your guide for today's tour
The waiter addressed him politely as Senor throughout dinner

definitions: Spanish title equivalent to Mrs or Madam used before a married woman's name
examples: Senora Martinez teaches Spanish at the local high school
The hotel manager greeted her warmly as Senora Rodriguez

definitions: capital and largest city of South Korea located in the northwest of the country
examples: Seoul hosts major technology conferences throughout the year
The subway system in Seoul is one of the world's largest

definitions: Jew of Spanish, Portuguese, or North African descent with distinct cultural traditions
examples: Sephardi communities maintain unique liturgical traditions and customs
The Sephardi synagogue uses different melodies for prayers

definitions: reddish-brown color or pigment originally obtained from cuttlefish ink
examples: Old photographs often have a distinctive sepia tone
The artist used sepia ink for the vintage-style drawings

definitions: native or inhabitant of Serbia or person of Serbian descent
examples: The Serb community celebrates their patron saint's day annually
Many Serbs emigrated to other countries during the conflicts

definitions: landlocked country in Southeast Europe located in the central Balkans
examples: Serbia declared independence from Yugoslavia in two thousand six
Belgrade serves as the capital city of Serbia

definitions: South Slavic language spoken primarily in Serbia and neighboring regions
relating to Serbia or its people, language, or culture
examples: Serbian uses both Cyrillic and Latin alphabets officially
She's learning Serbian to communicate with her relatives
The Serbian restaurant serves traditional dishes like cevapi
Serbian folk music features distinctive rhythms and instruments

definitions: vast ecosystem in East Africa famous for wildlife migrations between Tanzania and Kenya
examples: The Serengeti hosts the world's largest mammal migration annually
Safari tours in the Serengeti offer incredible wildlife viewing

definitions: person who maintains a church building and often rings bells and digs graves
examples: The sexton prepared the church for Sunday morning services
Our sexton has maintained the churchyard for thirty years

definitions: title of the former monarch of Iran and other rulers in Central Asia
examples: The last Shah of Iran fled during the revolution
Persian shahs ruled the empire for many centuries

definitions: container with a perforated top used for sprinkling or mixing ingredients
member of a Christian religious sect known for celibacy and communal living
examples: The bartender used a cocktail shaker to mix the drinks
She reached for the salt shaker on the dining table
The Shaker community is famous for simple, functional furniture
Shaker villages preserved traditional crafts and farming methods

definitions: William Shakespeare, renowned English playwright and poet of the Elizabethan era
examples: Shakespeare wrote thirty-seven plays and numerous sonnets
Students study Shakespeare in English literature classes worldwide

definitions: characteristic of or relating to William Shakespeare's works, style, or era
examples: The actor specializes in Shakespearean roles like Hamlet
Her thesis examines Shakespearean themes in modern literature

definitions: major port city in eastern China and global financial center
examples: Shanghai is China's most populous city and economic hub
The Shanghai skyline features numerous impressive skyscrapers

definitions: member of an Algonquian-speaking Native American people originally from the Ohio Valley
examples: The Shawnee nation has communities in Oklahoma today
Shawnee history includes notable leaders like Tecumseh

definitions: international hotel chain owned by Marriott International with properties worldwide
examples: They booked a conference room at the downtown Sheraton
The Sheraton hotel provided excellent service during our stay

definitions: member of a Tibetan people living on the high slopes of the Himalayas
experienced mountain climber or guide, especially on Himalayan expeditions
examples: The Sherpa community has lived in the Himalayas for centuries
Sherpa culture includes unique Buddhist traditions and festivals
Experienced sherpas are essential for safe Everest expeditions
The climbing team hired several sherpas for the ascent

definitions: archipelago in Scotland northeast of the mainland known for ponies and knitwear
examples: The Shetland Islands have a rich Norse heritage
Shetland wool is prized for its quality and warmth

definitions: one of two main branches of Islam that regards Ali as Muhammad's legitimate successor
examples: Shia Muslims commemorate Ashura with special religious observances
The Shia community represents about fifteen percent of Muslims

definitions: adherent of the Shia branch of Islam following Ali's succession
examples: Shiite pilgrims visit holy sites in Iraq annually
The Shiite clergy play important roles in religious governance

definitions: traditional religion of Japan focusing on ritual practices and connection with kami spirits
examples: Shinto shrines can be found throughout Japan's landscape
Many Japanese practice both Shinto and Buddhist traditions

definitions: major Hindu deity known as the destroyer and transformer within the Trimurti
examples: Devotees worship Shiva at temples across India daily
The festival honors Shiva with night-long prayers and fasting

definitions: member of a Native American people originally inhabiting parts of the western United States
examples: The Shoshone tribe traditionally lived in the Great Basin
Shoshone leader Sacagawea guided the Lewis and Clark expedition

definitions: harsh or unscrupulous moneylender, from the character in Shakespeare's Merchant of Venice
examples: The term Shylock unfairly stereotypes Jewish people historically
Critics debate whether Shylock is villain or victim

definitions: former name of Thailand used until nineteen thirty-nine
examples: Siam changed its name to Thailand officially in nineteen thirty-nine
The Kingdom of Siam had unique diplomatic relations historically

definitions: of or relating to Siam (former Thailand) or its people
breed of cat with pale fur and darker face, ears, feet, and tail
examples: Siamese art and architecture influenced Southeast Asian culture
The Siamese court maintained elaborate ceremonial traditions
Their Siamese cat has striking blue eyes
Siamese cats are known for being vocal and social

definitions: vast geographical region in Russia extending from the Ural Mountains to the Pacific Ocean
examples: Siberia contains enormous natural resources including oil and gas
The Trans-Siberian Railway crosses the entire Siberia region

definitions: of or relating to Siberia or its extremely cold climate and vast territories
examples: Siberian winters are notorious for extreme cold temperatures
The Siberian tiger is the largest living cat species

definitions: of or relating to Sicily, its people, or their dialect
native or inhabitant of the Italian island of Sicily
examples: Sicilian cuisine features fresh seafood and citrus fruits
She learned the Sicilian dialect from her grandparents
The Sicilian fisherman shared stories of the Mediterranean
Many Sicilians emigrated to America in the early twentieth century

definitions: largest island in the Mediterranean Sea, an autonomous region of Italy
examples: Sicily attracts millions of tourists with its ancient ruins
Mount Etna in Sicily is Europe's most active volcano

definitions: multinational conglomerate corporation headquartered in Germany focusing on industry, energy, and healthcare
examples: Siemens manufactures medical imaging equipment for hospitals worldwide
The engineer works at Siemens developing automation solutions
